chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas W. Nielsen, #428119 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, Repeater [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentences currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders costs to be paid out of prison wages.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  If defendant is accepted into Trempealeau County Recovery Court he shall comply with all Recovery Court rules.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
